body:
### Problem

Hi, I'm currently experiencing this problem in 0.10.

I'm having this error when I use tabs as for indention.
```
Error in decoration provider treesitter/highlighter.line:
Error executing lua: ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: Invalid 'end_col': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: in function 'fn'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:210: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:291: in function 'on_line_impl'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:367: in function <...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:361>
```

So far the languages I used that has this error are lua, javascript, and go.

Demo:

This is using Go.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/77670158/7176f902-e161-437b-a865-223780d15c09

This is for Lua.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/77670158/e949c46e-1059-49a6-adaa-3b5672857cc8

My soft fixes for this problem are disable treesitter syntax highlighting or use spaces for indention.

### Steps to reproduce

This is a treesitter/highlighter.lua problem, so I think I can't do it using ```nvim --clean```.

1. I did ```:set noexpandtab``` to use tabs for indention.
2. I typed ```<Tab><any first character>```.
3. Then error shows up after pressing the first character.

### Expected behavior

No error.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No.

### Operating system/version

Linux Mint 21.3

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.34.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty or tmux-256color

### Installation

Downloaded the tar.gz and extracted it to ~/.local/share

comment_data.body:
> This is a treesitter/highlighter.lua problem, so I think I can't do it using nvim --clean.

Yes, you can: the Lua parser is bundled and enabled by default. (I can't reproduce it with your steps and `--clean`.)

I tried doing the minimal.lua stuff

```
-- Run this file as `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`

for name, url in pairs {
  -- ADD PLUGINS _NECESSARY_ TO REPRODUCE THE ISSUE, e.g:
  -- some_plugin = 'https://github.com/author/plugin.nvim'
  treesitter = 'https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter',
  everforest = 'https://github.com/neanias/everforest-nvim'
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify('nvim_issue/' .. name, ':p')
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', '--depth=1', url, install_path }
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

-- indention options
vim.opt.autoindent = true
vim.opt.expandtab = false
vim.opt.tabstop = 3
vim.opt.softtabstop = 3
vim.opt.shiftwidth = 3
vim.opt.smartindent = true

require("nvim-treesitter.configs").setup {
   highlight = {
      enable = true
   },
}

vim.cmd.colorscheme "everforest"
```

The error did not showup...
I was able to replicate this issue with my nvim setup when programming in go.

See a similar error very frequently (nvim 0.10.0 on OSX, installed via brew) using https://github.com/nvim-orgmode/orgmode/commit/95fb795a422f0455e03d13a3f83525f1d00793ad.
When joining lines I get error "Invalid 'end_row': out of range."

To recreate:

minimal.lua:
```
vim.opt.rtp:prepend(vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/orgmode")
require("orgmode").setup {}
```

Sample file _test.org_:
```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, officia excepteur ex fugiat reprehenderit enim
labore culpa sint ad nisi Lorem pariatur mollit ex esse exercitation amet.
Nisi anim cupidatat excepteur officia. Reprehenderit nostrud nostrud ipsum
Lorem est aliquip amet voluptate voluptate dolor minim nulla est proident.
Nostrud officia pariatur ut officia. Sit irure elit esse ea nulla sunt ex
occaecat reprehenderit commodo officia dolor Lorem duis laboris cupidatat
officia voluptate. Culpa proident adipisicing id nulla nisi laboris ex in
Lorem sunt duis officia eiusmod. Aliqua reprehenderit commodo ex non
excepteur duis sunt velit enim. Voluptate laboris sint cupidatat ullamco ut
ea consectetur et est culpa et culpa duis.
```

    > nvim --clean -u minimal.lua test.org

When editor opens, `J` to join second line to first and I see:

```
Error in decoration provider treesitter/highlighter.line:
Error executing lua: ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: Invalid 'end_row': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: in function 'fn'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:210: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:291: in function 'on_line_impl'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:367: in function <....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/tree
sitter/highlighter.lua:361>
```

So far I've been unable to recreate the error with other file types.

Since I can't reproduce it using minimal.lua (the error doesn't show up), I decided to create a minimal config in order to pinpoint any plugins that can be related to the issue until the only remaining plugin is nvim-treesitter. Sadly the error still persist.

This is the minimal config repo: https://github.com/alexxGmZ/temp-nvim-config

I don't know if I have the same problem as you do, or not.
I had this situation when I inserted a new line using `<Return>`, and then deleting it & going back to the previous line using `<Backspace>`, this error would appear:

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):
Error executing lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405>
        [C]: in function 'nvim__redraw'
        ...re/nvim/site/pack/deps/start/mini.nvim/lua/mini/diff.lua:1909: in function 'redraw_buffer'
        ...re/nvim/site/pack/deps/start/mini.nvim/lua/mini/diff.lua:1321: in function ''
        vim/_editor.lua: in function <vim/_editor.lua:0>
```

setting ```highlight = { enable = false }``` in ```nvim-treesitter.configs``` setup table caused it to not happen, so maybe this is the plugin you are looking for?

or maybe it is not, idk. thanks for the workaround tho.

I can produce it with this setup

<details>

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):                                                                                                                                                
Error executing lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range                                                                                                 
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                     
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'                                                                                                                                                                      
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'                                                                                                                             
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'                                                                                                       
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'                                                                                                                   
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405>  
```

Versions
```
$ nvim --version
NVIM v0.11.3
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1748459687
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info

$ uname -r
6.15.6-arch1-1

$ foot --version
foot version: 1.22.3 +pgo +ime +graphemes -assertions

$ pacman --query --info tree-sitter-markdown
Name            : tree-sitter-markdown
Version         : 0.5.0-1

$ pacman --query --info tree-sitter
Name            : tree-sitter
Version         : 0.25.8-1
```
**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a markdown file with 100 lines of '- foo'; open nvim at last line
```bash
for i in {1..100}; do echo '- foo'; done > foo.md
nvim --clean +$ foo.md
```

`:lua vim.treesitter.start(1, 'markdown')`

Now press `dd` 1-5 times in quick succession and the error pops up.
</details>

---

### Edit:

✅ This issue does **not** occur when building from commit [`95dfb06`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/95dfb063daa709d303d0e37e86fbc8067950a830).

This suggests the bug was fixed **sometime between the last release and this commit**.

Leaving the reproducer for regression testing or verification. Feel free to delete comment.

For what it's worth, I'm able to consistently reproduce this on php by opening a large file (1358 files in my case). 
I'm using the appimage, latest version.

- Go near the end (say line 1345).
- Hit `O` to create a new empty line.
- Hitting `<esc>` and `dd` to delete it again.

Performing the same operation at line 1300 does _not_ produce this error. I experience that scrolling effects the issue.
Once it does not error, it keeps not erroring, unless I scroll back down.

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Error executing lua: ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range                                                                                                                                                                      
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'                                                                                                                                                                                                  
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'                                                                                                                                                                            
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'                                                                                                                                                                                        
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function <...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405> 
```

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: Invalid: 'end_col': out of range error in treesitter/highlighter.lua
